applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the pension life cover scheme rules document for several reasons: 1) The document is focused on establishing rules for a company pension life cover scheme and does not contain any provisions or procedures related to powers of attorney. 2) While the document discusses trustees, beneficiaries, and administrative powers, it does not address scenarios where someone might act on behalf of a consumer through a power of attorney. 3) The document's scope is specifically limited to defining scheme rules, trustee duties, and benefit provisions for company pensions in the event of death before retirement age. 4) The only parties mentioned in terms of authority are the trustees, employers, and administrators - there is no mention of power of attorney arrangements or procedures for handling them. 5) The document's administrative sections (particularly Section 4 on Trustee Duties and Powers) do not include any requirements for handling power of attorney situations.
regulation_title: Confirmation of power of attorney to be obtained where relevant
regulation_text: 124. (1) Where a regulated entity deals with a person who is acting for a consumer under a power of attorney, the regulated entity shall - (a) obtain a certified copy of the power of attorney, (b) in the case of an enduring power of attorney made under Part 7 of the Act of 2015 or an enduring power under the Act of 1996, satisfy itself as to the status of the power of attorney, and (c) operate within the limitations set out in the power of attorney. (2) In this Regulation, "enduring power of attorney" and "enduring power under the Act of 1996" have the meanings assigned to them in section 2 of the Act of 2015.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
